page.title: 02Dock Trade In Hartlepool
page.content: The first dock on the West Hartlepool side of the bay was started in 1845. All the docks on the West Hartlepool side of the bay are 6 to 7 metres in depth. All the inlets from the sea have lock gates so that the water level doesn't drop. The docks are in a semi-circle because that is the shape of the bay. There are four docks in West Hartlepool. Coal Dock, Jackson Dock, Union Dock and Central Dock. The Coal Dock is used for pleasure craft and H.M.S. Warrior. The busiest dock is Union Dock because of all the car imports. Jackson Dock is bulk cargo exports mainly to Spain. Central Dock is used for car imports. In 1982 Hartlepool Docks made just over Â£1,000,000 profit.
